citation.article-title: Chimaereicella alkaliphila gen. nov., sp. nov., a Gram-negative alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from a nonsaline alkaline groundwater.

p.s: Description of Chimaereicella alkaliphila sp. nov.

Chimaereicella alkaliphila (al.ka.li′phi.la. N.L. n. alkali from Arabic article al, the; Arabic n. qaliy, ashes of saltwort, soda; Gr. adj. philos, loving; N.L. fem. adj. alkaliphila, loving alkaline environments).
Chimaereicella alkaliphila forms long rod-shaped cells 0.5 μm in width by 2.1–3.3 μm in length.
Nonmotile.
Gram stain is negative.
Strictly aerobic and heterotrophic.
Colonies are small and red.
Oxidase and catalase positive.

The optimum temperature for growth is about 30 °C, no growth occurs at 10 or 40 °C; the optimum pH is 8.0, no growth occurs at pH 7.0 or 11.3; growth is faster without added NaCl, but grows up to 3.0% NaCl.
The respiratory quinone detected was MK7.
The predominant fatty acids are iso-15:0, iso-17:1 ω9c and 16:1 ω7c and or iso-15:2OH.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Hydrolyze arbutin, esculin, gelatin, hipurate and starch.
Does not hydrolyze casein or elastin.
The presence of DNAse and β-galactosidase was detected.
Urease and xylanase was not detected.
Is sensitive to ceftazidin, cephalothin, chloramphenicol and kanamycin.

The type strain of this species assimilates, arabinose, ribitol, d-frutose, d-mannose, sorbitol, α-methyl-mannoside, α-methyl-glucoside, salicin, sucrose, β-gentiobiose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate.

Acid is produced from galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, α-methyl-glucoside, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, β-gentiobiose, d-turanose and 5-ketogluconate.
The mole G+C ratio of the DNA of the type strain is 43.5 mol%.
This bacterium was isolated from water taken from the borehole at Cabeço de Vide in Southern Portugal.

The type strain, AC-74T, has been deposited in the Collection of the Institute Pasteur, Paris, France, as strain CIP108470T and in the BCCM/LMG Bacteria Collection, Ghent, Belgium, as strain LMG 22694T.
